intro: Campylotropis souliei, commonly known as the Sulié's climbing bupleurum, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its twining stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in late spring, followed by elongated, bean-like pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
